text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the answer to state that the Moral Rights breach (specifically the right to be identified/paternity right) only occurs when the infringing act is done by someone who 'publishes commercially or exhibits in public' (e.g., the fizzy drink company's advert). The candidate answer addresses Moral Rights under Section 77 (right to be identified) and states: 'The right to be identified as the author (the \"paternity right\") of your work when it is published commercially, exhibited, or included in a film or broadcast. However, I must be honest here: this right must be asserted under s.78...'. This directly addresses the condition specified in the rubric criterion by referencing the circumstances under which the right is engaged (publishing commercially/exhibiting in public) and the requirement for assertion, which is linked to the commercial exploitation by the advertiser.", "criterion_id": "c7044567-39eb-4f9b-b0f9-1e689184f731"}
